Job Posting:170959 - Position: F25 COOP Student, Data Solution Developer 170959 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 07/02/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 06/24/2025 03:54 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country City of Ottawa 110 Laurier Avenue West, 5th Flr Ottawa K1P 1J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 COOP Student, Data Solution Developer 170959 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 months CAD 49.107 per hour for 35 Major List Job Title: COOP Student, Data Solution Developer Job ID: 18029? Application Deadline: July 2, 2025 To be considered for this competition you must be enrolled in a registered co-op program at a Canadian post-secondary institution, and eligible for a Work Term during the specified period.?Students must?upload proof of enrolment in a co-op program when completing your application. JOB SUMMARY This job is exclusively for Coop Students who are enrolled in a recognized post-secondary co-operative education program. The mandate of Information Technology Services is to create business value by providing innovative and strategic technology solutions for the business operations of the City of Ottawa. You are responsible for assisting with assigned information technology solutions, projects, programs and/or services. You may work in various disciplines and functions within the Information Technology environment, such as desktop support, applications, planning, business analysis, project co-ordination, software development and technology architecture support. At the City, the work atmosphere is an open, fast-paced environment where you will have the opportunity to work both independently and as part of a team. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. The City of Ottawa promotes the principles of diversity and inclusion and adheres to the tenets of the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. We encourage applications from members of Indigenous, Black and other racialized communities, persons with disabilities, women and non-binary persons, persons of all ethnic origins, religions, sexual orientations, classes, gender identities and expressions. Candidates are encouraged to self-identify as a member of one or more designated employment equity groups in the self- identification questionnaire. The City of Ottawa provides accommodation to applicants during all parts of the hiring process, upon request. If contacted to proceed to the selection process, please advise us if you require any accommodation. Accessible formats and communication supports are available upon request. Please contact the Employee Service Centre at 613- 580-2424 extension 12211 or via email at esc-cse@ottawa.ca. Job Requirements EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Enrolment in a recognized post-secondary co-operative program in computer science, computer engineering, information technology or related field No experience required KNOWLEDGE • Computer science concepts, methodologies and practices Project management principles Knowledge of applicable health and safety legislation, including the rights and duties of workers • • COMPETENCIES, SKILLS AND ABILITIES • Critical thinking, problem-solving and analytical skills • Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing • Good interpersonal skills • Work effectively as a team member and independently • Good work ethic • Organized and dependable • Positive attitude • Self-motivated • Client service oriented Enjoy working in a dynamic environment • WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW • Language Requirement: English oral, reading, writing • Experience and formal training combined with demonstrated performance and ability may substitute for stipulated academic requirements. Please save a copy of the job poster. Once the closing date has passed, it will no longer be available. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
